title: Drawing, "Fountain Design with Three Bronze Animals", c. 1670
medium: Black and white chalk, brush and gray wash on brown laid paper
markings: Stamps: ph de Chennevieres [Lugt 2072]; The Cooper Union Museum [Lugt 645b]
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, below dragon: 3 p 10 po bronze; below lion: 3pi; above three-headed creature: demi relief/3pied; below three-headed creature: au magazin du Roy/ au Vieux Louvre.

Verso: Inscribed in graphite: Ces designs m'ont ete donnes par Horace/de Vielcaste. X bre 1859.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Renderings of three bronze sculptures of animals. Upper: a dragon turned to the right; center: A lion with open mouth turned to the right; lower: three-headed creature turned to the left.
